# researchr

<!-- badges: start -->
[![Lifecycle: experimental](https://img.shields.io/badge/lifecycle-experimental-orange.svg)](https://lifecycle.r-lib.org/articles/stages.html#experimental)
[![CRAN status](https://www.r-pkg.org/badges/version/kbruncati)](https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=researchr)
<!-- badges: end -->

The goal of researchr is to make finding funded research opportunities easier and more accessible for all. 

## Installation

You can install the development version of researchr like so:

``` {r, message=FALSE}
remotes::install_github('kbruncati/diviiproject')
```

## Example

This is a basic example which shows you how to solve a common problem:

```{r example}
library(researchr)
## basic example code
```
